name: MY.BERRY CAFE Coffee & Eats
address: 5587+2HJ, Jl. Melasti Ungasan, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: My experience at My Berry Cafe was delightful! The cappuccino was delicious. The service was exceptionally friendly and efficient, making me feel welcome and attended to. The ambiance was superb, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere for enjoying my coffee. I recommend this cafe to anyone looking for great coffee excellent service.
review 2:
A very atmospheric place with Russian cuisine‚ú®
The service is at the highest level, they will always come to you and offer help. Delicious cuisine, nice people, pancakes were super, coffee is very tasty. If you want to feel a pleasant atmosphere and have a delicious snack, come here
review 3: Found this place on our way to the beach. The furniture is nice and so are the staff there. Having tried the food here I have to say this was the best snack (I think?). The CREPES is super tasty, which is just right. And for those looking for a lunch I highly recommend the lunch combo, which is not only delicious but also of good price. In all a 5/5 restaurant üáÆüá©
review 4: The staff is incredibly friendly and respectful and the food is just amazing. After a beautiful sunset at the beach is a Crepe at My Berry the perfect refinement. This is a MUST-SEE Cafe
review 5: Great guys, outstanding service and so tasty Blin4ik (Crepe/Pancake)! Best I have ever ate until now. So nice coffee with fresh beans and the taste is just a dream in the morning. Will definitely come again and again

review 1: This place is so amazing!! The portion sizes are perfect and it is definitely on the cheaper side. All the food is so amazing especially the croissants and grilled chicken salad. The staff are so nice too! Definitely check this place out!

personally me, who lives nearby for almost a year this place is always on my list

Big breakfast and iced latte with caramel syrup. They have caramel syrup !!!
review 5: Everything at this cafe is nice :) Its a family business which is doing a great job. The coffee 10/10, the food 10/10 and the price is also very nice! I will come here way more often!

name: Edenia Private Villas
address: 5587+2HJ, Jl. Melasti, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
We booked Villa Didi for a month through Airbnb and thoroughly enjoyed every romantic day there!!!

This charming property is one of over 30+ Edenia Private Villas in Ungasan, Kuta Selatan, Bali.

Almost all the best beaches on the island of Bali will be found in the Bukit Peninsula of Kuta Selatan, south of Ngurah Rai International Airport.

Villa Didi is perfectly located for surfers & beach lovers.

Impressive white sand beaches such as Balangan, Karma, Padang-Padang, Bingin, Melasti, Green Bowl, Pandawa and Geger are just a short thrilling drive away from the villa.

Driving around the Bukit Peninsula is such a joy. We loved the slow relaxing drives along narrow undulating & meandering roads immensely!

The landscape here is stunning and dramatically cinematic!!!

For a sensational sunset treat, experience the hypnotic Kecak Dance at Uluwatu Temple one evening and spend another evening chilling out at Single Fin, Uluwatu's (actually Bali's) hippest cliff-top bar & restaurant.

Kuta beach is about 60 to 90 minutes away, depending on traffic. If you plan on going there, park your vehicle at Beachwalk, Bali's best shopping center.

There are a couple of Carrefour outlets on the island: their transmart hypermarket at Sunset Road is the largest most well-stocked one-stop supermarket on the island.

While at Villa Didi, be sure to use 2 different phones with 2 different SIM cards - one from Indosat (better option) and another from Telkomsel (backup option) - if you need to be online for mission critical work ... so that when connectivity fails with one telecommunications company, you have a different service provider as backup to connect with.

As to be expected, cellular reception at this particular geographically remote location is generally spotty; connectivity at the villa is best in the room on the highest floor.

Besides driving to Tanah Lot and checking out Legian & Seminyak along the way, we highly recommend a leisurely day trip to Kintamani: visit the amazing Monkey Forest in Ubud along the way; stop for lunch at the pretty Tegallalang rice terraces; and spend the afternoon soaking up one of Bali's best hot spring resorts - Toya Devasya - by the picturesque lake in the crater of an active volcano.

Have a FABULOUS TIME in beautiful Bali!!!

Andrew&Florence

P.S. Didi (villa owner) is extremely responsive & hospitable and his staff - Yek (property manager), Ketut (gardener) & Komang (maid) - will be very happy to welcome you!
review 2: Good place with family, enjoy, relax but wifi not working...
review 4: Amazing villas compound with a traditional touch

name: Adila Bali
address: Jl. Pura Batu Pageh No.79, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80364, Indonesia
review 1: Great price-quality ratio. The room is very spacious and clean, with big bathroom and beautiful balcony. You may have to walk a bit to get to the beach or any other place but it‚Äôs an amazing position if you want to go to the south beach clubs in Bukit or to Nusa Dua beach or Malasti. The staff was very friendly and they also had an amazing and loving doggo!
review 2:
I recently stayed here with my bf and unfortunately, the overall experience didnt meet expectations. Despite being a reputed hotel, the service was subpar from the moment of arrival. The staff were unfriendly, and the overall management of the hotel left much to be desired. One significant issue was the malfunctioning water heater, which remained unrepaired from the first day of our stay to the last.

furthermore, the hotel facilities appeared to lack safety measures. a particularly disappointing incident involved the disposal of my face masks. I placed them in our sharing refrigerator, only for them to be discarded without any explanation. this was especially frustrating as I had just purchased the masks (50 sheets), lol it‚Äôs all not about the price, just wondering ‚Äúwhy they did no excuses?‚Äù. such incidents reflect poorly on the hotel's management and customer service.

I strongly urge the hotel to address these issues promptly, as they significantly impact the overall guest experience. Improvements in management and a more attentive approach to customer service are needed for a more positive stay for future guests.

thanks üòä
review 3: I loved my stay in Adila Bali! My room was very spacious, it had a beautiful sea view and a large balcony where you can see both sunrise and a sunset. I also enjoyed the yoga classes and Balinese massages. Amazing restaurant with a lot of vegetarian options, a delicious big breakfast was included in my stay. The location is ideal for people who want to rest and relax. It was easy to rent a scooter and explore both local and touristic areas. Also Adila team is the best, they took amazing care of all my needs and requests. I will be coming back for sure!
review 4: This hotel is a perfect retreat. It offers a simple and cozy atmosphere, and we loved the interior design and the welcoming staff. The location was convenient for our needs. The only minor downsides were the lack of a minibar in the room and the occasional presence of geckos. If you're not too concerned about these issues, it's an excellent choice for a relaxing stay.
review 5: Amazing, so quite and peaceful, very very spacious rooms, really clean and tidy, ocean view, sea breeze, safe and secure, Coco the villa dog is so sweet, shes clean, vaxed and doesn't hang around when eating, she just wants love and sleeps. üòÄ. Staff were beyond helpful and friendly, really calming atmosphere. Highly highly recommend. They also sell amazing hand made (by the yoga instructor) bracelets, rings and necklaces. The fooftop open air massage area is so nice. Yoga classes available, Great price, great location. So tranquil!!! Vegan/vegetarian yet so close to other options.

name: Warung U DEDA
address: Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: There is a Russian menu. Pretty good food. The downside is that there are a lot of flies and sometimes dogs walk around. tables are not always comfortable
review 2: Hello friend's üòÑüòÑüòÑ good location Uluwatu... Good atmosphere... Russian kitchen üî•üî•üî• üôèüïâÔ∏è Very tasty, for connoisseurs of Russian cuisine. Thank you for places like this.
review 3:
Simple bamboo warung yet great Eastern European kitchen and nice staff (and pretty cheap!)
Highly Recommended !
review 4: This pleasant aged local man was able to well reproduce Russian cuisine. Delicious Olivier salad and perfect dressed herring salad. There is too much dough in dumplings, but I hope it will improve. I‚Äôll come back necessarily to try the Borsch.
review 5:
cute little place
we liked all food we‚Äôve ordered
syrniki is not the best on the island but good enough knowing who made it

super liked the owner
definitely come back

name: Warung Sunny
address: Jl. Melasti No.18, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80364, Indonesia
review 1: We ate here for dinner, and then lunch. The staff/owners were friendly and gave good recommendations for vegetarian meals. The food itself was well portioned and fantastic value for money. The gado gado was much tastier than similar dishes we had tried elsewhere and the nasi goreng/mi goreng was simple but yum. Also quite fun to try the chocolate toast. Would definitely recommend coming to Warung Sunny for a good value meal.
review 2: This place is so underrated. Their foods is delicious with affordable price. Serving indonesian food in the right taste. I hope they can last longer, because they are delicious and affordable, unlike the eatery near them that serve pricy food. They know how to make my tummy happy without making wollet crying ü§£ü§£
review 3: The best warung in the area! We went there 4 days in a row and weren‚Äôt disappointed. The peanut sauce with chicken was legendary! Good prices!
review 4: Nice little warug run by a beautiful family! If you love traditional Indonesian food this place is just for you! Very tasty indonesian dishes, my favorite is gado gado! Also super delicious fresh juicesüòçyum! And it is very cheap! If you are around, you should definitely visit!
review 5: This restaurant will always be near and dear to both me and my fianc√©e‚Äôs hearts. We went here after my proposal and we really wanted local food and we were both craving fried rice. Amazing beautiful flavors and also well seasoned. We like things hot and their dessert was really flavorful. Will definitely come back. Local food, local and friendly service and yummy yummy. Something different about fresh nasi campur and nasi goreng! Terima kasih!!

name: BUKIT BRUNCH UNGASAN
address: Jl Batu Pageh, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: Me and my girfriend stayed in Ungasan for 1.5 weeks and every morning we went here for breakfast/brunch. The food is super fresh made with healthy ingredients, and tastes amazing. The staff is very kind and the atmosphere inside the restaurant is so calm and relaxing. We would recommend this place to everyone wanting a tasty meal made out of good ingredients. 10/10.
review 2: Great place, bright, clean and cozy. Delicious breakfasts, very tasty coffee, different from most cafes in the neighborhood. Prices are average, not overpriced. Croissant with bacon was delicious, lots of bacon. From the disadvantages of a long shock, we waited for food about 30 minutes. Otherwise everything is in order. I recommend it if you are not in a hurry.
review 3: Best coriander rice. Great selection of healthy bowls salad with tuna poke, chicken or plant based and vegan options. My partner had a good breakfast burrito, will be back to try some other dishes and will add photos. Small space with only 8 seats inside but cute
review 4: The prettiest, cleanest and coziest breakfast place in the area! Everything looks so pretty here, from the logo to the menu, meals, and decor inside. Amazing coffee, loved my breakfast choice. And the waitresses were so friendly and polite! I‚Äôll definitely come back here.
review 5:
The food and coffee is very good!

Food:

We got the rice bowls (tuna poke bowl & vegan bowl) and the portion is very big - good value for money! Vegetables are fresh and good variety.
The sauce of the vegan bowl is not that good - the one of the tuna bowl was way better. I would suggest to ask for a different sauce for the vegan bowl.

Coffee:

I got an americano and my bf a cappuccino. I  would have gotten a cappuccino with oat-milk but 20k for oat-milk is very overpriced for the average 10k at other spots. Besides that, good coffee and especially the mugs are very cute!

Atmosphere:

When we arrived we were quite surprised about the size of the restaurant. Sitting outside is way to loud and inside its just very small and you cannot have a private conversation. It can feel a bit awkward bc of that. However, the music they play is very nice and not too loud which is very nice.

Summery

Would come back for the tuna poke, the vegan bowl wasn‚Äôt as good bc of the sauce. I didn‚Äôt like the size of the spot and I wished the oat-milk would be cheaper. The bowls and mugs are very cute which I really liked. Was good for once!ü´∂

name: Surfhouse Bali 007
address: Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: I would 100% recommend this place to everyone! A beautiful villa with clean rooms, plenty of common areas (equipped kitchen and terrace), and an amazing pool with another terrace, perfect for chilling out! It's the perfect place to relax and surf in South Bali. Additionally, there are plenty of suitable places to work if you need to. The Surfhouse also offers the opportunity to practice yoga with an experienced teacher. The operations staff is incredibly helpful and will advise you with everything you need. If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! I believe it won't be the last time I'll be there!
review 2: how to find out about a free room and book accommodation? please send your phone number
review 3: This place is by far the best guesthouse I have stayed in Bali. I have been staying in Surfhouse Bali every time I travel to the south of the island. The operating staff is very friendly and always come forward when it comes to any kind of request. There is an attached yoga shala which is also perfect for working out. Definitely recommend
review 4: Best stay in Bali with loving and kind people. Perfect place if you just want to relax and escape the stress. Will always come back to this place.
review 5: Very beutifull and clean villa with outdoor waterpool. There is a lot of restaurants very near so even if there is big kitchen we didnt used it.

name: Villa Blu Maya
address: 5598+RRX, Ungasan, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Just returned from a 3-day, 2-night stay with 8 members of my family, and we are delighted with our experience here. The villa truly exceeded all my expectations. It is nestled in a tranquil and lush environment, providing a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. It's easily accessible, and although there are several other villas nearby, the atmosphere remains calm and serene, especially during the evenings.

The villa's kitchen is fully equipped, making it convenient for preparing meals. The swimming pool is immaculate, and the bedrooms' air conditioning ensures a comfortable and refreshing night's sleep. The bathrooms are clean and well-maintained.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and we wouldn't hesitate to return in the future. We will also enthusiastically recommend this villa to our friends as it offers a perfect retreat in a beautiful setting.
review 2:
Closed to main road,Easy to find.
calm atmosphere with tropical feel.

review 2: What a wonderful place!! Great location and peaceful area for a stay in Uluwatu. Efficient staff and literally the cleanest accommodation found during my trip. Top-notch Villa just a trow of a stone from the best cocktails bars in Bali and white sands beaches!
review 3:

address: Jl. Melasti No.20, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: LOVED this place. Everyone in Bali is beautiful but I think these guys were one of the best. Lovely relaxed atmosphere, I could have stayed here all night!!!
review 2: Thank you , Suandra, for your kindness, your delicious coktails & food,  + your smile ( and pet your nice dog Cheeky for us ) :-) Nicolas & Arnaud, from France
review 3: Very friendly. Local restaurant but amazing. Food was really good, recommend! Any travellers will feel very welcome here amongst locals
review 4: Fantastic people, food and fun, everything you could wish for, so it‚Äôs not a beach club, it‚Äôs personal!

Good instagram page that posts updates (although we tried to follow the address/directions link on insta and at the time they were wrong - best to use google maps). Lovely place with a chilled environment and plays sport - we watched the England Lionesses game and tried to come back the next day and forgot it‚Äôs shut on Mondays! review 1: Rujak is local desert fruits (mostly un-ready fruits) with some spicy soup, such as fish soup, fish soup with sugar, brown sugar soup or brown sugar paste. The flavor sour, sweet or hot. Another way to eat fruits in Indonesia!

review 1: No longer open from what I can see. Went one evening it said it was open and there was no sign of it being a restaurant
review 2: Small warnung hidden away from the main streets. The food is simply great - classics like nasi goreng, mie goreng are available but the best is chicken bbq!
review 3: Great little home warung in residential area.  Tasty food and great prices

name: Vila Bukit Indah (Bali)
address: Jl. Tukad Jinah Br. Dinas Kelod No.14, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: The villa is great. We stayed here for one month. It has a good location in the center of Bukit , so you can go whenever you want quickly. The master bedroom is on the second floor, but  there are no doors between bathroom and bedroom. And two small rooms on the first floor.Just so you know :) Also you can see nice sunsets from the villa. The area is a quiet place. Nobody bothers you. Suli was very helpful, even in the evening we could tell that we ran out of water and she got a balloon of water in 10 minutes. Downside is the road to the villa. It was my pain :) I would return here if I come to Bukit again, that‚Äôs why I can recommend it.
review 2:
We stayed at Vila Bulit Indah for the last 2 nights of our 2 week Bali honeymoon and wish we had stayed here longer! The owners of the villa are unbelievably sweet, and supply you with everything you need to make your stay feel like home.

The villa itself is absolutely breathtaking, videos and photos don‚Äôt do it justice. It‚Äôs very clean, and very well looked after.
We loved it so much that we ended up having food delivered to us because we didn‚Äôt want to leave!!

It is a little bit off the beaten road, so keep in mind that you will not be walking distance from shops/food, but if you‚Äôre good with a scooter you‚Äôre close to whatever you need! And they also have a driver who can drive you to where you need to go.

We stayed in some very beautiful villas through out the two weeks we were in Bali as we explored different parts of the island, but none of them compared to Vila Bukit Indah.

Also, the villa is PRIME sunset watching location. Absolutely stunning. We‚Äôll be back!
review 3: Lived in the villa for two months.  the villa is great!  very comfortable, well-groomed, beautiful, with a large territory.  very clean, no insects.  The staff and the owner are wonderful people.  Amazing sunsets right from the balcony - bonus) We are very happy we found this place, would love to come back again and again. Thank you ü§ç
review 4: Booked via online travel app, paid full, and went there only to be informed that they were not available. Disappointing.
review 5: Nice area and big villa. Helpfull staff
